Header: Car bomb kills 13 policemen in Aden, Yemen – interior ministry
Content: An explosives-laden car exploded near a police station in Yemen, killing at least 13 police officers in the southern port city of Aden, according to an interior ministry statement.No one has claimed responsibility for the attack. Past car attacks in Yemen have been carried out by Islamist militant group al Qaeda, one of Yemen’s many destabilising forces. The explosion came after Yemen’s Iran-aligned Houthi movement said it launched missile and drone attacks on Thursday on a military parade in Aden, the seat of the Saudi-backed government, that killed more than 30 people according to medical and security sources. Yemen’s Prime Minister Maeen Abdulmalik Saeed and Saudi Arabia’s envoy to Yemen, in separate tweets, accused Iran of being behind the parade attack claimed by the Houthis and the blast at a police station in the southern port city.
